question_text: Find the effective resistance in the diagram above
subject: physics
explanation: The resistors are in series ∴ Reff = R1 + R2 + .....= 4 + 4 + 4 + 4 + 4 + 4 = 24 Ω

question_text: Given the inductor of inductance 5mH, 10mH and 20mH connected in series, the effective inductance is
subject: physics
explanation: Left = L1 + L2 + L3= 5mH + 10mH + 20mH = 35mH

question_text: If electron are accelerated from rest through a potential difference of 10kv, what is the wavelength of the associated electron[m = 9.1 x 10-31kg, e = 1.6 x 10-19C, h = 6.6 x 10-34js]
subject: physics

question_text: 14N +4He →17O + X728In the equation above, the particles X is
subject: physics
explanation: for the conversion of mass 14 + 4 = 17 + x ∴ X = 18 - 17 = 1for conservation pf charge:7 + 2 = 8 + yy = 9 - 8 = 1Thus, the element is 11X which is equal to hydrogen nucleus ( proton)

question_text: The diagram above shows a plank RS pivoted its center of gravity O and is in equilibrium with the weight P and Q. If a weight 2P is added to P the plank will be in equilibrium again by
subject: physics
related_lessons: Force and Newton's Laws of Motion
explanation: If 2P is added P, the beam will bend at R side. So to keep it in equilibrium. P should be moved nearer to 0

options.answer: addding a weight Q to Q
moving P further away from O

question_text: The efficiency of the pulley system shown above is 80%. find the effort E required to lift the load of 1200N
subject: physics
explanation: VR = No. of pulleys = 4Efficiency = M.A/V.R x 100% = loadEffort x 100%_V.R∴80 = 1200 x 100 x 1100__Effort4∴ Effort = 1200 x 100 = 375N_80 x 4

question_text: The diagram above is the heating curve for a solid QR is the
subject: physics
related_lessons: Temperature, Kinetic Theory, and Gas Laws
explanation: At melting point there is no change temperature

question_text: The above figure shows the motion of a progressive wave along a string. The particle motion of the medium is in direction
subject: physics
explanation: Particles of the transmitting medium in transverse wave oscillate in a direction perpendicular to the propagation of the wave

question_text: If a convex lens of focal length 12cm is used to produce a real image four times the size of the object, how far from the lens must the object be placed?
subject: physics

question_text: The dimension of electromotive force are `
subject: physics
explanation: Electrical work W = QE,Where Q is the quantity of change and E is the electromotive force.∴ E = W = FxDQ_ItWhere D is the displacement,I = current and t = timeBut dimension of force,= unit of mass x unit of Acceleration  = unit of mass xunit of velocityunit of time  = unit of mass x unit of displacement__unit of time x unit of timeML/T2 = MLT-2∴ Dimension of emf E = MLT-2L = ML2T-3I-1__IT

question_text: The resultant of two forces 12N and 5N is 13N. What is the angle between the two forces?
subject: physics
related_lessons: Force and Newton's Laws of Motion
explanation: R2 - P2 + Q2 = 122 + 52= 144 + 25 = 169∴R = √169 = 13N∴ angle between the forces is 90o

question_text: A force F required to keep a 5 kg mass moving round a cycle of radius 3.5 m at a speed of 7 ms-1. What is the speed, if the force is tripled?
subject: physics
related_lessons: Force and Newton's Laws of Motion
explanation: The force which is centripetal F = MV2_R=5 x 723.5= 70V = √(Fr) and if F is tripped, then V = √(3Fr)/m= √(3x70x3.5)/5= 12.1ms-1

question_text: A body of mass 4 kg resting on a smooth horizontal plane is simultaneously acted upon by two perpendicular forces 6N and 8N. Calculate the acceleration of the motion
subject: physics
explanation: Smooth plane has negligible friction ∴ only the resultant of the perpendicular forces is acting on the body, which is given asF = √ 82 + 62  = √ 64 + 36  = √ 100 = 10NBut F = Ma∴ a = F/M = 10/4 = 2.5 ms-1

question_text: A block of aluminum is heated electrically by a 30 w heater if the temperature rises by 10°c in 5 minutes, the heat capacity of the aluminum is
subject: physics
explanation: Heat supplied = Heat gained Pt = MCDθ30 x 5 x 60 = c x 10where c = mc which is the heat capacity c = (30 x 5 x60)/10 = 900 JKg-1

question_text: An object 4 cm high is placed 15 cm from a concave mirror of focal length 5 cm. The size of the image is
subject: physics

question_text: I. for current amplification.II. for voltage stabilization. III. for power amplification.IV. as a switch.which of the above are the uses of transistor?
subject: physics
related_lessons: Electric Current, Resistance, and Ohm's Law
explanation: Transistor is used for amplification of current, power and as a switch in logic gates.

question_text: The d.c generator has essentially the same components as the a.c generator except the presence of?
subject: physics
explanation: To correct and A.C generator with a D.C generator the slip ring is replaced with split-ring communicator

question_text: A step-down transformer has a power output of 50 W and efficiency of 80%. if the mains supply voltage is 200 v, calculate the primary current of the transformer.
subject: physics
explanation: Efficiency = (power output)/power input x 100%= 1s VS x 100% 1pVp∴ (80)/100 = (50)/IP x 200I P = (50 x 100)/80 x 200 = 3.125 A

question_text: Caesium has a work function of 3 x 10-19J. the maximum energy of liberated electrons when it is illuminated by light of frequency 6.7 x 1014HZ is?[h = 6.6 x 1010-34Js]
subject: physics
explanation: Max kinetic energy = Energy of incident electron - work function. EK = hf - w= 6.6 x 10-34 x 6.7 x 1014 - 3 x 10-19= 4.422 x 10-19 - 3 x 10-19= 1.422 x 10-19J

question_text: zener diode is used for?
subject: physics
explanation: Zener diode is useful in stabilized power supply i.e to keep steady the voltage of a power supply.

question_text: When a pure semiconductor is heated, its resistance
subject: physics
related_lessons: Electric Current, Resistance, and Ohm's Law
explanation: Heating a pure semiconductor increases the mobility of electrons and holes and hence the conductivity. thus, the resistance decreases on heating

question_text: In the microscope, the eyepiece lens merely acts as?
subject: physics
explanation: The basic function of microscope is magnification

question_text: An observer with normal eyes views an object with magnifying glass of focal length 5 cm. the angular magnification is?[least distance of distinct vision D = 25 cm]
subject: physics
explanation: Angular magnification, M = ((D)/F + 1) where D is least distance of distinct vision ∴ M = ((25)/5 + 1) = -6

question_text: A short chain is sometimes attached to the back of a petrol tanker to?
subject: physics
related_lessons: Conductors and Electric Fields in Static Equilibrium
explanation: The friction between the tanker and air creates charges which the chain conducts to the ground.

options.answer: ensure the balancing of the tanker
conduct excess charges to the car

question_text: An electric generator has e.m.f. of 240 V and an internal resistance of 1Ω if the current supplied by the generatoris 20A when the terminal voltage is 220 V, find the ratio of the power supplied to the power dissipated?
subject: physics
related_lessons: Electric Current, Resistance, and Ohm's Law
explanation: Power supplied = IE = 20 X 240 = 4800 WPower dissipated = IV = 20 X 220 = 4400 W(Power supplied)/Power dissipated = (4800 W)/4400 W = (12)/11

question_text: A generator is on daily use and in the process, ten 60 W and five 40 W tungsten bulbs are on for the same time interval. the energy consumed daily is?
subject: physics
explanation: Energy consumed = power x time= (60 W x 10 + 40 W x 5) x 24 h= (600 W + 200 W ) x 24 h= 800 W x 24h = 19200 w h= 19.2 kWh

question_text: I. Total internal reflection of light.II. Conservation of light energy.III. Relative motion of the earth, sun and moon.IV. Rectilinear propation of light.Which of the above is a phenomenon of total solar eclipse?
subject: physics
explanation: Due to rectilinear propagation of light we have ecslipse which occur as a result relative motion of the earth, sun and moon

question_text: An object of height 4cm is placed in front of a cuboid pinhole camera of size 6 cm. if the image formed is 2 cm high, how far is the object from the pinhole?
subject: physics
explanation: Magnification = (image height)/object height = (lenght camera)/object distance from pin-hole∴(2)/4 = (6)/X X (4 x 6)/2 = 12 cm

question_text: An object of heights 5 cm is placed at 20 cm from a concave mirror of focal length 10 cm. the image height is?
subject: physics

question_text: Convex mirror are used as driving mirrors because images formed are?
subject: physics
explanation: Image formed by convex mirror is always erect, virtual and diminished

question_text: An object placed at the bottom of a well full of clear water appears closer to the surface due to?
subject: physics
explanation: Real depth and apparent dept is due to refraction

question_text: If the partial pressure of water vapour at 27°C is 18 mm Hg and the saturated vapour pressure of the atmosphere at the same temperature is 24 mm Hg, the relative humidity at this temperature is?
subject: physics
related_lessons: Temperature, Kinetic Theory, and Gas Laws
explanation: Relative Humidity = (S.V.P. of water at dew point)/S.V.P of    water at air temperature =(18)/24 x 100% = 75%

question_text: In a good thermos flask, the main cause of heat loss is?
subject: physics
explanation: Since the cork is in contact with the walls of the flask, little conduction takes place

options.answer: the plastic base of the thermos flask
the silvered walls and shiny metals

question_text: Given the progressive wave equation y = 5 sin (2000 πt - 0.4x), calculate wave length
subject: physics
explanation: Comparing y = 5sin (200 πt - 0.4X) with the wave equation y = A sin (wt -KX) K = (2π)/λ = 0.4  ∴ λ = (2π)/0.4 = 15.7M

question_text: The fundamental property of a propagating wave which depends only on the source and not the medium of propagation is the?
subject: physics
explanation: Timber/ quality depends on the overtones or harmonics, and timber is a characteristic property of source of sound.

question_text: When cold water is poured on a can containing hot water, the can collapses because the
subject: physics
related_lessons: Gauge Pressure, Absolute Pressure, and Pressure Measurement
explanation: Cold water reduces the temperature of the hot water inside the can causing the contraction of the hot water. This reduces the pressure inside the can and the can collapses due to the external greater expression.

options.answer: steam condeses and occupies the partial vacuum in the can
external air pressure counter balances the pressure within the can
steam expands to occupy the vacuum remaining in the can
external pressure becomes greater than the pressure within the can.

question_text: An empty density bottle weighs 2 N. if its weighs 5 N when filled with water and 4 N when filled with olive oil, the relative density of olive oil is
subject: physics
explanation: relative density = (weight of substance )/weight of equal volume of water = (4 - 2)/5 - 2 = (2)/3

question_text: The thermometric properties of a thermocouple is the change in?
subject: physics
explanation: Temperature difference between hot and cold junctions of thermocouple is proportional to the emf. generated

question_text: During summer, the balance wheel of a clock expands.what effect does this have on the accuracy of the clock?
subject: physics
explanation: The elastic potential energy of the balance wheel reduces as the wheel expands, therefore the clock will loose time.

options.answer: the accuracy of the clock is not affected

question_text: A sealed flask contains 600cm3 of air at 27°C and is heated to 35°C at constant pressure. The new volume is?
subject: physics
related_lessons: pv Diagrams and Their Relationship to Work Done On Or by a Gas

question_text: If a body mass 5kg is thrown vertically upwards with velocity u,at what height will the potential energy equal to the kinetic energy?
subject: physics
related_lessons: Converting Between Potential Energy and Kinetic Energy
explanation: From V2 = U2 + 2as O = U 2 - 2gH, since at maximum height H, the final velocity, v = O.∴ H = (U)2/2gPE = KE at (1)/2 H = (U)2/2g x (1)/2 = U2 4g

question_text: Counting of currency notes with moist fingers is based on the principles of?
subject: physics
explanation: since currency and finger contain unlike molecules, the force involved is adhesion

question_text: A motorcycle of mass 100kg moves round in a circle of radius 10m with a velocity of 5 ms-1. find the coefficient of friction between the road and the tyres.
subject: physics
explanation: F = (mv)2/r = (100 x 5)2 = 250N R = mg = 100 x 10 - 1000N coefficient of friction, µ = (F)/R = (250)/1000 = 0.25

question_text: A spring of force constant 500 NM-1 is compressed such that its length shortens by 5cm. The energy stored in the spring is?
subject: physics
explanation: Energy stored in a spring = (1)/2 K e2 = (1)/2 x 500(0.05)2 = 0.625J

question_text: In the hare's apparatus, water rises to a height of 26.5 cm in one limb. if a liquid rises to a height of 20.4 cm in the other limb, what is the relative density of the liquid?
subject: physics
related_lessons: Temperature, Kinetic Theory, and Gas Laws
explanation: hlpl = hwpwwhere, L =liquid and W = water (pl)/pw = (hw)/hl = (26.5)/20.4  = 1.299

question_text: I. Force (N)II.Torque (NM)III. Current (A)IV. Power (W)Which of the above are the correct S. I: units of the quantities indicated?
subject: physics
explanation: Torque has the same unit as moment = Nm∴i, iii and iv have correct units.

question_text: Which of the following is NOT a vector quantity?
subject: physics
related_lessons: Summarizing the Graphical Method of Vector Addition and Subtraction
explanation: Altitude is just a measure of height, regardless of direction.

question_text: If a wheel 1.2 m in diameter rotates at one revolation per second, calculate the velocity of the wheel.
subject: physics
related_lessons: Gyroscopic Effects: Vector Aspects of Angular Momentum

question_text: I. All the three forces must be concurrent.II. The upward force is equal to the downward force.III. The algebraic sum of the moment about any point must be zero.which of the above conditions must hold for a body acted upon by a system of three coplanar forces equilibrium?
subject: physics
explanation: Option ii is one of the condition of an equilibrium of parallel forces only i and iii are correct

question_text: What is the frquency of vibration if the balance wheel of a wrist watch makes 90 revolutions in 25 s?
subject: physics
explanation: Frequency = (No. of revolutions)/ Time = (90)/25 = 3.6 Hz

explanation: Electrical work W = QE,Where Q is the quantity of change and E is the electromotive force.∴ E = W = FxDQ_ItWhere D is the displacement,I = current and t = timeBut dimension of force,= unit of mass x unit of Acceleration  = unit of mass xunit of velocityunit of time  = unit of mass x unit of displacement__unit of time x unit of timeML/T2 = MLT-2∴ Dimension of emf E = MLT-2L = ML2T-3I-1__IT

question_text: Find the effective resistance in the diagram above
subject: physics
explanation: The resistors are in series ∴ Reff = R1 + R2 + .....= 4 + 4 + 4 + 4 + 4 + 4 = 24 Ω

question_text: Given the inductor of inductance 5mH, 10mH and 20mH connected in series, the effective inductance is
subject: physics
explanation: Left = L1 + L2 + L3= 5mH + 10mH + 20mH = 35mH

question_text: 14N +4He →17O + X728In the equation above, the particles X is
subject: physics
explanation: for the conversion of mass 14 + 4 = 17 + x ∴ X = 18 - 17 = 1for conservation pf charge:7 + 2 = 8 + yy = 9 - 8 = 1Thus, the element is 11X which is equal to hydrogen nucleus ( proton)

question_text: The diagram above shows a plank RS pivoted its center of gravity O and is in equilibrium with the weight P and Q. If a weight 2P is added to P the plank will be in equilibrium again by
subject: physics
related_lessons: Force and Newton's Laws of Motion
explanation: If 2P is added P, the beam will bend at R side. So to keep it in equilibrium. P should be moved nearer to 0

options.answer: addding a weight Q to Q
moving P further away from O

question_text: The efficiency of the pulley system shown above is 80%. find the effort E required to lift the load of 1200N
subject: physics
explanation: VR = No. of pulleys = 4Efficiency = M.A/V.R x 100% = loadEffort x 100%_V.R∴80 = 1200 x 100 x 1100__Effort4∴ Effort = 1200 x 100 = 375N_80 x 4

question_text: The above figure shows the motion of a progressive wave along a string. The particle motion of the medium is in direction
subject: physics
explanation: Particles of the transmitting medium in transverse wave oscillate in a direction perpendicular to the propagation of the wave
